intro: Hirtella piresii, commonly known as the Piresia hirtella, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to Brazil and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and dense, hairy foliage. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and covered in fine pubescence, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Hirtella piresii is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
